question_text: What does a 'no boot' condition mean and how do you differentiate it from other startup problems?
answer_options: Computer has no power at all - no lights, fans, or sounds
Computer powers on but fails to load any operating system or reach bootable state
Computer starts but immediately shuts down due to overheating
Computer displays BIOS setup screen but won't continue
correct_answer: Computer powers on but fails to load any operating system or reach bootable state
explanation: A 'no boot' condition means the computer powers on but fails to load any operating system or reach a bootable state. It's differentiated by: system powers on (lights/fans work), POST may complete (no beep codes), but no OS loading occurs. This differs from no power (nothing happens) or POST failure (beep codes present).
